intro: Uragoga xanthocephala, commonly known as the yellow-headed uragoga, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that contrast with its dark green foliage. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
